revised_title: Receptor Regulation of Calcium Release and Calcium Permeability in Parotid Gland Cells
tldr: This article investigates the mechanism by which hormones and neurotransmitters regulate fluid secretion in exocrine glands, focusing on the role of calcium as a second messenger. The authors find that receptor activation in parotid gland cells releases calcium from a cellular pool associated with the plasma membrane, and that phosphatidic acid may directly mediate calcium influx into the acinar cell.
